intro: Lavoisiera humilis, commonly known as the small lavoisiera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Lavoisiera humilis is often found in grasslands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
